byline.original: By JACK HEALY and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS

lead_paragraph: The city has an enviable record for clearing cases, but is fighting to keep up with the pace. “I’ve got a lot of tired people,” one officer said.

headline.print_headline: Murders Strain a Force Used to Solving Them
headline.main: In Las Vegas, Rising Murders Strain a Police Force Used to Solving Them

snippet: The city has an enviable record for clearing cases, but is fighting to keep up with the pace. “I’ve got a lot of tired people,” one officer said....
abstract: Spike in homicide rate in Las Vegas is taxing city police department, where detectives have long prided themselves on high rate at which they solve homicides; rise in homicides is  consistent with rest of country, as America's murder rate increased almost 11 percent in 2015, although criminologists note rate is far lower nationwide than in 1990s.
